awd_titl_txt: NSF-CGP Fellowship:  Studies on Single Crystal              Molybdenum Carbide
awd_abstract_narration: 9600323  Oyama    This proposal supports the collaboration of Dr. Ted Oyama of  the Department of Chemical Engineering at Virginia  Polytechnic Institute and Dr. Yasuhiro Iwasawa of the  Department of Chemistry at the University of Tokyo.  Project  funding will enable Dr. Oyama to spend one year in Japan,  resident at the University of Tokyo, in order  to study the structure and adsorption properties of single  crystal molybdenum carbide.  Dr. Oyama has previously  studied the catalytic properties of molybdenum carbide in  the form of supported and unsupported powders.  The  collaboration with Prof. Iwasawa will allow fundamental  studies of the system using advanced physico-chemical tools  available in Prof. Iwasawa's laboratory.  These include  ultra-high vacuum spectroscopies and scanning tunneling  microscopy.    This proposal brings toeether research scientists from two  countries working in the area of new materials and  catalysis. The U. S. scientist will have the opportunity to  become familiar with research techniques, equipment, and  facilities at the University of Tokyo while carrying out the  research mission.  This proposal thus fulfills the  objectives of the Program in its exchange and transfer of  scientific knowledge through an international collaboration.  ***
